itemDescription: Archbishop of Birmingham; British Roman Catholic bishop

wikipedia_page.main: John McIntyre (1 January 1855 – 21 November 1934) was an English prelate who served as the Roman Catholic Archbishop of Birmingham from 1921 to 1928.

response: | John McIntyre
* John McIntyre (1921-1928)
*John McIntyre (1912-1917), appointed official of the Roman Curia and titular archbishop; later returned here as Archbishop
John McIntyre may refer to:
* John McIntyre (cricketer) (born 1944), New Zealand cricketer
* John McIntyre (racing driver) (born 1977), New Zealand racing driver
* John McIntyre (hurler) (born 1961), Irish hurling manager

After the war Bernard went to Oscott College in Birmingham to train to be a priest. Ordained to the priesthood on 1 November 1924, he finished his studies at the Venerable English College in Rome in 1927. Griffin then worked as private secretary to John McIntyre, the Archbishop of Birmingham, until 1937. From 1929 to 1938, he served as diocesan chancellor of Birmingham, director of studies of the Catholic Evidence Guild, Catholic representative on the BBC's religious advisory committee, and administrator of diocesan charitable homes.
*Most Rev John McIntyre (1855-1935), Archbishop of Birmingham
